benchmark_details.name: V AGU (Video Anomaly Grounding and Understanding)
benchmark_details.overview: V AGU is the first benchmark that integrates anomaly grounding and anomaly understanding in video anomaly detection, providing annotations for anomaly category, semantic explanation, precise temporal grounding, and Video QA.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating and enabling video anomaly detection methods that integrate semantic understanding and temporal grounding.

data.source: Integrated from public datasets (CUV A, UCF-Crime, XD-Violence) and collected 7,567 high-quality anomalous videos from platforms like YouTube, BiliBili, and TikTok.
data.annotation: Manual annotation with human verification involving multiple annotators.

methods: Evaluation of anomaly classification, understanding, and grounding capabilities; Video Question Answering
metrics: JeAUG (Joint Evaluation of Anomaly Understanding and Detection)
methodology.calculation: JeAUG combines scores of semantic accuracy and grounding precision, adjusting scores based on video length.
methodology.interpretation: JeAUG scores represent the effectiveness in both anomaly understanding and grounding tasks.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted on the proposed benchmark demonstrate its robustness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The data acquisition strictly complies with copyright regulations and implements privacy protection for identifiable features.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study adheres to ethical guidelines regarding data handling and participant protection.
